attributes.action: increase MP's salaries to reflect their status
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Successive givernments have capped MP's salaries in the forlorne hope that the electorate are won over.

This has resulted in the current fiasco of a low basic + allowances to "top up" to a living wage.

It can not be equitable that we pay Doctors, Head Teachers, Council Leaders etc. salaries in excess of £120,000 per year but expect MP's to work for £65,000.

I want MP's who can devote their energies to the task in hand FULL TIME and not having second or third jobs to give a living wage.

Low salaries are also a recipie for corruption.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
